member.summary: Returns name of the item that can be used to identify item from the code.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BaseItem.GlobalName
member.summary: Gets or sets the global name of the item that is used to synchorize the Global properties for the item across all instances with same global name. Note that only instances that belong to the same control are synchronized. GlobalItem must be set to true to perform the synchoriznation. You can find more information and list of properties that are synchorized in help file.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BaseItem.ShouldSyncProperties
member.summary: Gets whether global properties should synchronized.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BaseItem.SupportedOrientation
member.summary: Gets orientation within container that is supported by this item. If item does not support certain orientation the container automatically hides it when container switches into that orientation.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BaseItem.GlobalItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item is global or not. This flag is used to propagate property changes to all items with the same name. Setting for example Visible property on the item that has GlobalItem set to true will set visible property to the same value on all items with the same name.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BaseItem.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container. Do not change the value of this property. It is managed by system only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BaseItem.KeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the item when on Ribbon Control or Ribbon Bar. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PopupItem.CreatePopupContainer(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the popup container control which is a parent/holder control for the controls you want to display on the popup. This method can be used if you do not wish to handle the PopupContainerLoad to add controls to the popup container. After calling this method you can access PopupContainerControl property to add your controls to be displayed on the popup.
member.param: Indicates whether PopupContainerLoad events are fired.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PopupItem.PopupContainerLoad
member.summary: Occurs when popup container is loading. Use this event to assign control to the popup container. If you want to use same control that you added to the popup container after popup is closed you must handle the PopupContainerUnload event and remove the control from the popup container so it is not disposed with the container.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.PopupItem.PopupContainerUnload
member.summary: Occurs when popup container is unloading. Use this event to save any state associated with the control that was contained by the container or to remove the control from the container so it is not disposed with container.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.CustomColorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom color name. Name specified here must be represented by the coresponding object with the same name that is part of the Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors collection. See documentation for Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors for more information. If color table with specified name cannot be found default color will be used. Valid settings for this property override any setting to the Color property. Applies to items with Office 2007 style only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color of the button. Color specified applies to buttons with Office 2007 style only. It does not have any effect on other styles. Default value is eButtonColor.Default

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.ButtonStyle
member.summary: Gets/Sets the button style which controls the appearance of the button elements. Changing the property can display image only, text only or image and text on the button at all times.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.summary: Specifies the Button icon. Icons support multiple image sizes and alpha blending.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonItem.SplitButton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether button appears as split button. Split button appearance divides button into two parts. Image which raises the click event when clicked and text and expand sign which shows button sub items on popup menu when clicked. Button must have both text and image visible (ButtonStyle property) in order to appear as a full split button.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemControl.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Indicates to control that all further update operations should not result in layout and refresh of control content. Use this method to optimize the addition of new items to the control. This method supports nested calls meaning that multiple calls are allowed but they must be ended with appropriate number of EndUpdate calls. IsUpdateSuspended property returns whether update is suspended.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemControl.EndUpdate
member.summary: Indicates that update operation is complete and that control should perform layout and refresh to show changes. See BeginUpdate for more details.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.KeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the Key Tips access key or keys for the item when on Ribbon Control or Ribbon Bar. Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. For example assigning the FN to KeyTips property will require the user to press F then N keys to select an item. Pressing the F letter will show only keytips for the items that start with letter F.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ItemContainer.AutoCollapseOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-collapse (fold) when clicked. When item is on popup menu and this property is set to false, menu will not close when item is clicked.

member.name: T:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization
member.summary: Desribes interface that provides custom serialization support for items.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.InvokeSerializeItem(DevComponents.DotNetBar.SerializeItemEventArgs)
member.summary: Invokes SerializeItem event.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.InvokeDeserializeItem(DevComponents.DotNetBar.SerializeItemEventArgs)
member.summary: Invokes DeserializeItem event.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.HasSerializeItemHandlers
member.summary: Gets whether any handlers have been defined for SerializeItem event. If no handles have been defined to optimize performance SerializeItem event will not be attempted to fire.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ICustomSerialization.HasDeserializeItemHandlers
member.summary: Gets whether any handlers have been defined for DeserializeItem event. If no handles have been defined to optimize performance DeserializeItem event will not be attempted to fire.

member.name: T:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SerializeItemEventArgs
member.summary: Represents arguments for SerializeItem event which allows you to add custom serialization data to definitions saved by control.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SerializeItemEventArgs.Item
member.summary: Gets reference to item being serialized or de-serialized.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SerializeItemEventArgs.ItemXmlElement
member.summary: Gets reference to instance of XmlElement that item is serialized to or is being de-serialized from. You should not change any data directly on this element.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SerializeItemEventArgs.CustomXmlElement
member.summary: Gets the reference to XmlElement that you can serialize to or de-serialize any custom data from. You can add child elements or set the attributes on this XmlElement when handling SerializeItem event. When handling DeserializeItem event you can load same data from this element.

member.name: T:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SerializeItemEventHandler
member.summary: Defines delegate for SerializeItem event.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BaseItemControl.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Indicates to control that all further update operations should not result in layout and refresh of control content. Use this method to optimize the addition of new items to the control. This method supports nested calls meaning that multiple calls are allowed but they must be ended with appropriate number of EndUpdate calls. IsUpdateSuspended property returns whether update is suspended.

member.summary: Occurs when caption button is clicked. Caption button is button displayed on bars with grab handle style task pane.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DockTabClosing
member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars when end-user attempts to close the individual DockContainerItem objects using system buttons on dock tab. Event can be canceled by setting the Cancel property of event arguments to true. This even will occur only after user presses the X button on tab that is displaying the dockable windows/documents.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.TabStripStyleChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the TabStrip style which used on dockable windows has changed. This event gives you opportunity to change the style of the tab strip by accessing Bar.DockTabControl.Style property.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.PreRender
member.summary: Occurs before the bar control is rendered. This event is fired once for each part of the bar control being rendered. Check the Part property of the event arguments to identify the part being rendered. You can cancel internal rendering by setting Cancel property.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.PostRender
member.summary: Occurs after the bar control is rendered and allows you to render on top of the default rendering provided by the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.LastFocusControl
member.summary: Returns the reference to the control that last had input focus. This property should be used to determine which control had input focus before bar gained the focus. Use it to apply the menu command to active control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the redering mode used by control. Default value is eRenderMode.Global which means that static GlobalManager.Renderer is used. If set to Custom then Renderer property must also be set to the custom renderer that will be used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.Renderer
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom renderer used by the items on this control. RenderMode property must also be set to eRenderMode.Custom in order renderer specified here to be used.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab text is always visible while bar is in auto-hide state. Default value is false which indicates that only text for the active dock tab is visible.

member.summary: Gets or sets the selected DockContainerItem if bar represents dockable window.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tab (DockContainerItem) index for Bars with LayoutType set to eLayoutType.DockContainer. Index corresponds to the index of the DockContainerItem in Bar.Items collection.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Indicates Bar background image.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.AutoCreateCaptionMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets whether caption button menu for bars with grab handle task pane is automatically created. Caption menu when automatically created will display the list of all items from Items collection and it will maintain only one item from the list as visible item. To create custom caption menu that is displayed when user clicks the caption button handle CaptionButtonClick event.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.AutoSyncBarCaption
member.summary: Gets or sets whether caption (text) of the bars with dock container layout is automatically set to the selected dock container item text.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.CanUndock
member.summary: Specifies whether Bar can be undocked. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.CanTearOffTabs
member.summary: Specifes whether end-user can tear-off (deattach) the tabs on dockable window.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.CanReorderTabs
member.summary: Specifes whether end-user can reorder the tabs on dockable window.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockTab
member.summary: Gets or sets whether bar or DockContainerItem that is torn-off this bar can be docked as tab to another bar. Default value is true which indicates that bar can be docked as tab to another bar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockTop
member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked on Top dock site or not. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockBottom
member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked on Bottom dock site or not. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked on Left dock site or not. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockRight
member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked on Right dock site or not. Does not apply to stand alone bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.CanDockDocument
member.summary: Specifes whether Bar can be docked as document. Default value is false. See DotNetBarManager.EnableDocumentDocking for more details.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.Stretch
member.summary: Specifies whether Bar will stretch to always fill the space in dock site. Applies to the dockable bars only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DisabledImagesGrayScale
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gray-scale algorithm is used to create automatic gray-scale images. Default is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DockOffset
member.summary: Gets/Sets the distance from the far left/top side of the docking site or suggests the order of the docked bar. Upon serialization this property will contain actual left/top position of the bar. You can use it to re-order the bars docked on the same line. Property value is relative to the other bars docked on the same line when it is used to change the order. For example setting DockOffset value to 10 will place the bar just after the last bar on the same line that has DockOffset value less than 10. If there is no bar with DockOffset value less than 10 the bar will be placed in first position.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DockLine
member.summary: Gets/Sets the dock line.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DockTabAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the dock tab alignment.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.AlwaysDisplayDockTab
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab that shows all dock containers on the bar is visible all the time. By default tab is hidden when there is only one item displayed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.LockDockPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether bar is locked to prevent docking below it. Applies to undockable bars only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DockOrientation
member.summary: Gets/Sets the orientation of the Bar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.Docked
member.summary: Returns whether Bar is docked or not.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DockedSite
member.summary: Returns the Bars dock site.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DockSide
member.summary: Gets/Sets the dock side for the Bar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.InitalFloatLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the inital floating location. This location will be used when DockSide is set to None.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.ShowToolTips
member.summary: Indicates whether Tooltips are shown on Bars and menus.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.DesignerSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control is selected in designer.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.AlwaysDisplayKeyAccelerators
member.summary: Gets or sets whether accelerator letters for menu or toolbar commands are underlined regardless of current Windows settings. Accelerator keys allow easy access to menu commands by using Alt + choosen key (letter). Default value is false which indicates that system setting is used to determine whether accelerator letters are underlined. Setting this property to true will always display accelerator letter underlined.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.SetRibbonControlStyle(DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl,DevComponents.DotNetBar.eDotNetBarStyle)
member.summary: Applies specified style to Ribbon control and all other controls that are managed by the ribbon control. This method is useful for example when switching the color tables for Office 2007 renderer. Once the GlobalManager.Renderer color table is changed you can call this method to apply color table changes to the Ribbon Control and other controls managed by it.
member.param: RibbonControl to set the style on.

member.param: RibbonBar control to set the style on.

member.summary: Applies current color scheme and layout properties to the bottom menu container used by the top-level file menu. This container usualy contains Options and Exit buttons. Applies to Office 2007 style only.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme)
member.summary: Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to apply Black color scheme to all DotNetBar control on given form. The color table will be changed only for controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Color table to select and apply.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ChangeOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control,DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.eOffice2007ColorScheme,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Generates and Changes the Office 2007 color table for all DotNetBar controls on the form. You can use this function for example to create custom color scheme based on the base color and apply it to all DotNetBar control on given form. The new color table will be applied only to controls that have Office 2007 style. Any other style will be unchanged.
member.param: Form to apply color table to.
Base color table to use for creation of custom color table that will be applied.
Base color used to create custom color table.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPredefinedColorSchemes.ApplyOffice2007ColorTable(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Applies current Office 2007 style color table to all DotNetBar controls on the form.
member.param: Reference to the form or parent control that contains DotNetBar controls you would like to apply color table to.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatFrequentCommands
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Quick Access Toolbar Frequently used commands. You should add existing buttons to this collection that you already have on the RibbonBar controls or on the application menu. The list will be used to construct the frequently used menu that is displayed when Customize Quick Access Toolbar menu is displayed and it allows end-user to remove and add these frequently used commands to the QAT directly from this menu. Note that items you add here should not be items that are already on Quick Access Toolbar, i.e. in RibbonControl.QuickToolbarItems collection.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.KeyTipsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether KeyTips functionality is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AllowMerge
member.summary: Gets or sets whether merge functionality is enabled for the control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control height is set automatically based on the content. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.GlobalContextMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the Context menu bar associated with the this control which is used as part of Global Items feature. The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. You should assign this property to enable the Global Items feature to reach your ContextMenuBar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether custom caption and quick access toolbar provided by the control is visible. Default value is false. This property should be set to true when control is used on Office2007RibbonForm.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the form caption text when CaptionVisible=true. Default value is NULL which means that system font is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height of the caption provided by control. Caption height when set is composed of the TabGroupHeight and the value specified here. Default value is 0 which means that system default caption size is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.RibbonStripIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the ribbon strip. The indent setting is useful when control is used with caption visible and the Office 2007 style start button. The indent specified here will move the ribbon strip so the start button does not overlap the tabs. Value of this property is used only when CaptionVisible = true. Default value is 46.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.FadeEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mouse over fade effect is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.KeyTipsFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font that is used to display Key Tips (accelerator keys) when they are displayed. Default value is null which means that control Font is used for Key Tips display.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroups
member.summary: Collection of RibbonTabItemGroup items. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more RibbonTabItem object through the RibbonTabItem.Group property to visually group tabs that belong to same functions. These tabs should be positioned next to each other.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroupHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned. Default value is 10 pixels. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabGroupsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned is visible. Default value is false. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true. Use TabGroupHeight property to control height of the group line.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.DefaultGroupFont
member.summary: Gets or sets default font for tab groups. This font will be used if font is not specified by group style element.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.BackgroundStyle
member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.SelectedRibbonTabItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected RibbonTabItem. RibbonTabItems are selected using the Checked property. Only a single RibbonTabItem can be selected (Checked) at any given time.

member.summary: Returns reference to internal ribbon strip control.

member.summary: Gets whether collapsed ribbon is displaying the selected ribbon panel as popup.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether control is expanded or not. When control is expanded both the tabs and the tab ribbons are visible. When collapsed only tabs are visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.ImagesLarge
member.summary: ImageList for large-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.TabStop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can give the focus to this control using the TAB key. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.MdiSystemItemVisible
member.summary: Specifies whether the MDI system buttons are displayed in ribbon strip when MDI Child window is maximized.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CanSupportGlass
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Ribbon control employs the Windows Vista Glass support when available. This is managed automatically by Ribbon Control and no setting is necessary on your part.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether control can be customized and items added by end-user using context menu to the quick access toolbar. Caption of the control must be visible for customization to be enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.UseExternalCustomization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether external implementation for ribbon bar and menu item customization will be used for customizing the ribbon control. When set to true it enables the displaying of RibbonBar and menu item context menus which allow customization. You are responsible for adding the menu items to context menu to handle all aspects of item customization. See "Ribbon Control Quick Access Toolbar Customization" topic in help file under How To. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.EnableQatPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets whether end-user customization of the placement of the Quick Access Toolbar is enabled. User can change the position of the Quick Access Toolbar using the customize menu. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.UseCustomizeDialog
member.summary: Gets or sets whether customize dialog is used to customize the quick access toolbar. You can handle the EnterCustomize event to display your custom dialog instead of built-in dialog for customization. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.CategorizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the categorization mode for the items on Quick Access Toolbar customize dialog box. Default value categorizes items by the ribbon bar they appear on.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatPositionedBelowRibbon
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Quick Access toolbar is positioned below the ribbon.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the Quick Access Toolbar layout description. You can use the value obtained from this property to save the customized Quick Access Toolbar into registry or into any other storage object. You can also set the saved layout description back to restore user customize layout.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonControl.QatLayoutChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Quick Access Toolbar has been customized by end-user. You can use value of this property to determine whether Quick Access Toolbar layout that can be accessed using QatLayout property should be saved.

member.summary: Occurs before tooltip for an item is shown. Sender could be the BaseItem or derived class for which tooltip is being displayed or it could be a ToolTip object itself it tooltip is not displayed for any item in particular.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.SuspendLayoutDisplay
member.summary: Suspends the layout and painting of the control. When you want to perform multiple operations on the explorer bar and you want to ensure that layout of the items on it and painting is not performed for performance and appearance reasons set this property to true. Once you want to enable layout and painting set the property back to false and call RecalcLayout method. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.GroupButtonCollapseHot

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.GroupButtonCollapsePressed
member.summary: Specifies custom image to be used as button on ExplorerBarGroup item to collapse the group. This Image is used when left mouse button is pressed while cursor is over the button. Default value is null which indicates that default button is used.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPopupCloseEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the closing of the ribbon menu is canceled.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonPopupCloseEventArgs.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source object that was cause of the menu closing. For example this could be reference to an item that was clicked. Default value is null which indicates that there is no information about the object that caused closing available.

remarks.para: Following is the possible list of types that this property could be set to and causes for closing:

list.item: BaseItem - when an item is clicked the Source will be set to the instance of the item that was clicked.
RibbonControl - when parent form RibbonControl is on loses the input focus the Source will be set to the RibbonControl

RibbonTabItem - when tab menu is displayed and user clicks the same tab to close the menu. The RibbonTabItem with EventSource=Code will be also set as source when user double-clicks the tab to maximize the ribbon.
Any other type if RibbonControl.PopupRibbon method is called by your code.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.ApplyStyle(DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle)
member.summary: Applies a "child/inherited" style to this style. Use this method to create style hierarchies.
member.remarks: This method is used to support style hierarchies where a base style is defined and inherited/child styles are derived and based on it. By using this method on the base style you can apply only style changes defined by the child style. For example if you defined a base style for normal user interface element then in most cases you do not want to redefine the styling for the case when same user interface element is selected. You will just defined the behavior of the selected state and then apply it to the base normal style using ApplyStyle method.
member.param: Style to apply to current style.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for UI element. If used in combination with BackgroundColor2 is specifies starting gradient color.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor2 property.

member.summary: Resets Hoover timer.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.BeforeTooltipDisplay
member.summary: Occurs just before tooltip is displayed and gives you opportunity to cancel showing of tooltip.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.MarkupLinkClick
member.summary: Occurs when text markup link is clicked. Markup links can be created using "a" tag, for example: Markup link

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.IgnoreFormActiveState
member.summary: Gets or sets whether form active state is ignored when control is deciding whether to show tooltip. By default this property is set to false which indicates that tooltip will be shown only if parent form is active. When set to true the form active state is ignored when deciding whether to show tooltip.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SuperTooltip will be shown for the controls assigned to it. Default value is true. You can set this property to false to disable SuperTooltip for all controls assigned to it.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.ShowTooltipImmediately
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip is shown immediately after the mouse enters the control. The default value is false which indicates that tooltip is shown after system hover timeout has expired which provides slight delay before tooltip is shown.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.MinimumTooltipSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum tooltip size. Default value is 150 width and 24 height.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.TooltipDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration in seconds that tooltip is kept on screen after it is displayed. Default value is 20 seconds. You can set this value to 0 to keep tooltip displayed until user moves mouse out of control or application loses focus.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DelayTooltipHideDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay time for hiding the tooltip in milliseconds after mouse has left the control. Default value is 0 which means that tooltip will be hidden as soon as mouse leaves the control tooltip was displayed for. You can use this property to provide the user with enough time to move the mouse cursor to the tooltip so user can act on the content of the tooltip, like hyper links.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.CheckOnScreenPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltip position is checked before tooltip is displayed and adjusted to tooltip always falls into screen bounds. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.PositionBelowControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip position in relationship to the control tooltip is providing information for. Set this property to false if you want tooltip to be displayed below the mouse cursor. Default value is true which indicates that tooltip is displayed below mouse cursor but it is positioned below the control that it provides the information for so it is not covering its content.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DefaultTooltipSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets default setting for new toolips you create in design time. If all your tooltips have common elements you can change this property to reflect these default setting before you start writing tooltips for all controls on the form. As you start creating new tooltips for controls on the form default values specified here will be used as starting values for new tooltip you are creating.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DefaultSuperTooltipInfo
member.summary: Returns instance of default tooltip information used in design-time.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.SuperTooltipInfoTable
member.summary: Gets the reference to internal hastable that contains reference to all controls and assigned SuperTooltips. This collection must not be modified directly and it is automatically managed by the SuperTooltip component. You can use it for example to change the color for all SuperTooltips managed by the component but you should not add or remove items to it. Instead use SetSuperTooltip methods to add or remove the tooltip for a component.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.IsTooltipVisible
member.summary: Returns whether tooltip is visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.SuperTooltipControl
member.summary: Gets reference to instance of tooltip control if any has been created at the time call is made.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SuperTooltip.DefaultFont
member.summary: Gets or sets default tooltip font. Default value is null which means that default system font is used.

member.summary: Extensibility interface that custom components may implement so SuperTooltip can be provided for them.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ISuperTooltipInfoProvider.DisplayTooltip
member.summary: This event should be triggered by the component when it wants to display SuperTooltip. Normally this event would be equivalent of MouseHover event but you can trigger it in response to anything else. Sender for this event must be object that implements ISuperTooltipInfoProvider interface.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ISuperTooltipInfoProvider.HideTooltip
member.summary: This event should be triggered by component when it wants to hide SuperTooltip. For example this event might be triggered when mouse leaves your component. Sender of this event must be object that implements ISuperTooltipInfoProvider interface.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.SplitButton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether button appears as split button. Split button appearance divides button into two parts. Image which raises the click event when clicked and text and expand sign which shows button sub items on popup menu when clicked. Button must have both text and image visible (ButtonStyle property) in order to appear as a full split button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.ImagePosition
member.summary: Gets/Sets the image position inside the button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.FadeEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether mouse over fade effect is enabled. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.HotTrackingStyle
member.summary: Indicates the way button is rendering the mouse over state. Setting the value to Color will render the image in gray-scale when mouse is not over the item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the redering mode used by control. Default value is eRenderMode.Global which means that static GlobalManager.Renderer is used. If set to Custom then Renderer property must also be set to the custom renderer that will be used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.Renderer
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom renderer used by the items on this control. RenderMode property must also be set to eRenderMode.Custom in order renderer specified here to be used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.SubItemsExpandWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the expand part of the button item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with this button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.Tooltip
member.summary: Gets/Sets informational text (tooltip) for the button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.ColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets button Color Scheme. ColorScheme does not apply to Office2007 styled buttons.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the button will auto-expand when clicked. When button contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.ThemeAware
member.summary: Specifies whether button is drawn using Windows Themes when running on OS that supports themes like Windows XP.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.IsThemed
member.summary: Gets whether Windows Themes should be used to draw the button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.Checked
member.summary: Gets or set a value indicating whether the button is in the checked state.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.CustomColorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom color name. Name specified here must be represented by the coresponding object with the same name that is part of the Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors collection. See documentation for Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors for more information. If color table with specified name cannot be found default color will be used. Valid settings for this property override any setting to the Color property. Applies to items with Office 2007 style only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ButtonX.ColorTable
member.summary: Gets or sets the predefined color of the button. Color specified applies to buttons with Office 2007 style only. It does not have any effect on other styles. Default value is eButtonColor.Default

Use KeyTips property when you want to assign the one or more letters to be used to access an item. member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the explicit height of the caption provided by control. Caption height when set is composed of the TabGroupHeight and the value specified here. Default value is 0 which means that system default caption size is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.CaptionVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether custom caption line provided by the control is visible. Default value is false. This property should be set to true when control is used on Office2007RibbonForm.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.CaptionFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the font for the form caption text when CaptionVisible=true. Default value is NULL which means that system font is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.RibbonStripIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the ribbon strip. The indent setting is useful when control is used with caption visible and the Office 2007 style start button. The indent specified here will move the ribbon strip so the start button does not overlap the tabs. Value of this property is used only when CaptionVisible = true. Default value is 46.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.TabGroupHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels of tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned. Default value is 14 pixels. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.TabGroupsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab group line that is displayed above the RibbonTabItem objects that have group assigned is visible. Default value is false. To show tab groups you need to assign the RibbonTabItem.Group property and set TabGroupsVisible=true. Use TabGroupHeight property to control height of the group line.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonStrip.TabGroups
member.summary: Collection of RibbonTabItemGroup items. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more RibbonTabItem object through the RibbonTabItem.Group property to visually group tabs that belong to same functions. These tabs should be positioned next to each other.

member.summary: Gets or sets the insertion index for the ribbon tab item that is created when ribbon bars are merged into the ribbon control. Default value is -1 which means that ribbon tab item is appended to the existing ribbon tab items.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color position in multicolor gradient blend. Values less or equal to 1 are used as percentage specifing percentages of distance along the gradient line. Values greater than 1 are used as absolute pixel values of distance along the gradient line.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ForceDefinitionLoad
member.summary: Forces the loading of the definition specified in DefinitionName property. By default definition is loaded after parent form handle has been created and form is loaded. However, under certain circumstances you might need DotNetBar to load definition right away so you can access bars and items. We recommend moving the code to Form Load event and leaving the loading process for DotNetBar definition as is.

member.summary: Occurs before tooltip for an item is shown. Sender could be the BaseItem or derived class for which tooltip is being displayed or it could be a ToolTip object itself it tooltip is not displayed for any item in particular.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockTabClosing
member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars when end-user attempts to close the individual DockContainerItem objects using system buttons on dock tab. Event can be canceled by setting the Cancel property of event arguments to true. This even will occur only after user presses the X button on tab that is displaying the dockable windows/documents.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.summary: Occurs when TextBoxItem input text has changed.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ButtonCheckedChanged
member.summary: Occurs when Checked property of an button has changed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.GlobalContextMenuBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the Context menu bar associated with the this control which is used as part of Global Items feature. The context menu bar assigned here will be used to search for the items with the same Name or GlobalName property so global properties can be propagated when changed. You should assign this property to enable the Global Items feature to reach your ContextMenuBar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ParentForm
member.summary: Gets or sets the form DotNetBarManager is attached to.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ParentUserControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the user control DotNetBarManager is parented to when on user control and providing popups only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets whether component has been disposed.
member.remarks: Disposed will return true after Dispose method has been executed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DisposeGCCollect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether GC.Collect() is called when this component is disposed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.MinimumClientSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum client size that docking windows will try to maintain for the client area (not occupied by dock windows). Note that this value is suggested value and cannot be observed when form is resized below the minimum size required for the given layout. Default value is 48x48 pixels.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockingHintsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether DotNetBar provides docking hints for easy docking of bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.EnableFullSizeDock
member.summary: Gets or sets whether user can control how first bar is docked when using docking hints (default value is True). When enabled (default value) placing the mouse over the middle docking hint will dock the bar at partial size and using the far docking hint will dock bar at full size. Full size indicates that dock site which hosts the bar consumes all the space of the parent form while partial size indicates that dock site consumes the full size minus the space of the other dock sites. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ApplyDocumentBarStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether uniform styling is applied to bars docked as documents. Default value is true which means that bar that will be docked as document will have it's style changed so it fits in default document styling. Such bars will have GrabHandleStyle=None, DockTabAlignment=Top and AlwaysDisplayDockTab=true. Set this property to false to have bars keep these properties once they are docked as documents. Value of these properties will be returned back to the default values once bar is not docked as document.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.Bars
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Bar objects associated with DotNetBarManager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IsDefinitionLoaded
member.summary: Gets whether definition is loaded.

member.summary: Gets the collection of all items that are used for end-user design-time customization.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ContextMenus
member.summary: Gets the collection of all popup menus managed by DotNetBarManager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DispatchShortcuts
member.summary: Indicates whether shortucts handled by items are dispatched to the next handler or control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AutoDispatchShortcuts
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of shortcut keys that are automatically dispatched to the control that has focus even if they are handled and used by one of the items. This gives you fine control over which shortcuts are passed through the system and which ones are marked as handled by DotNetBar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ShowResetButton
member.summary: Indicates whether Reset buttons is shown that allows end-user to reset the toolbar state.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.Images
member.summary: ImageList for images used on Items. Images specified here will always be used on menu-items and are by default used on all Bars.

member.summary: ImageList for medium-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ImagesLarge
member.summary: ImageList for large-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.SuspendLayout
member.summary: Suspends the bar layout for all bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.MenuDropShadow
member.summary: Specifes whether drop shadow is displayed for Menus and pop-up Bars. OfficeXP Style only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlphaBlendShadow
member.summary: Specifes whether to use Alpha-Blending shadows for pop-up items if supported by target OS. Disabling Alpha-Blended shadows can improve performance.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DisabledImagesGrayScale
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gray-scale algorithm is used to create automatic gray-scale images. Default is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.UseHook
member.summary: Gets or sets whether hooks are used for internal DotNetBar system functionality. Using hooks is recommended only if DotNetBar is used in hybrid environments like Visual Studio designers or IE.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DevComponents#DotNetBar#ICustomSerialization#HasSerializeItemHandlers
member.summary: Gets whether any handlers have been defined for SerializeItem event. If no handles have been defined to optimize performance SerializeItem event will not be attempted to fire.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DevComponents#DotNetBar#ICustomSerialization#HasDeserializeItemHandlers
member.summary: Gets whether any handlers have been defined for DeserializeItem event. If no handles have been defined to optimize performance DeserializeItem event will not be attempted to fire.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IsLoadingDefinition
member.summary: Returns whether definition is being currently loaded.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IncludeDockDocumentsInDefinition
member.summary: Gets or sets whether document bars are saved in definition file. Default value is false which means that document bars are not saved as part of definition file. You can set this value to true to save document bar to definition file and be able to load them.
member.remarks: Note that by default Document bars that you created during design-time get member variables assigned to them by Windows Forms designer. If you decide to save definition of such bars and load definition back member variables will not point to correct bar instances since loading definition recreates all bars from scratch. You should always use Bars collection to access bars when saving and loading definitions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the DotNetBar definition string.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Fill dock site used by DotNetBarManager. Fill dock site is most commonly used as dock site for document type docking.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ThemeAware
member.summary: Specifies whether bars are drawn using Themes when running on OS that supports themes like Windows XP.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.Style
member.summary: Sets the style of all items in DotNetBar Manager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets Color scheme for all bars. Note that you need to set UseGlobalColorScheme to true to indicate that this ColorScheme object will be used on all bars managed by this instance of DotNetBarManager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.UseGlobalColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets whether ColorScheme object on DotNetBarManager is used as a default ColorScheme for all bars managed by DotNetBarManager. Default value is false which indicates that ColorScheme on each Bar is used. When set to true each bar will use the ColorScheme settings from DotNetBarManager and it will ignore any setting on the Bar.ColorScheme object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlwaysShowFullMenus
member.summary: Indicates whether the Personalized menu setting is ignored and full menus are always shown.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlwaysDisplayKeyAccelerators
member.summary: Gets or sets whether accelerator letters for menu or toolbar commands are underlined regardless of current Windows settings. Accelerator keys allow easy access to menu commands by using Alt + choosen key (letter). Default value is false which indicates that system setting is used to determine whether accelerator letters are underlined. Setting this property to true will always display accelerator letter underlined.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IsThemeActive
member.summary: Returns whether theme support is enabled on the OS that supports themes like Windows XP.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AllowUserBarCustomize
member.summary: Indicates whether the CustomizeItem (allows toolbar customization) is added for new Bars end users are creating.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IgnoreF10Key
member.summary: Gets or sets whether DotNetBar ignores the F10 key which when pressed sets the focus to menu bar

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ShowFullMenusOnHover
member.summary: Indicates whether the items that are not recenly used are shown after mouse hovers over the expand button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ShowToolTips
member.summary: Indicates whether Tooltips are shown on Bars and menus.

member.summary: Indicates whether item shortcut is displayed in Tooltips.

member.summary: Gets or sets the time (in milliseconds) that passes before the BalloonTip appears.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a Balloon window is displayed even when its parent form is not active. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BalloonTip.BalloonControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the internal Balloon control that is used to display Balloon. This property will have valid value only during time Balloon is actually displayed on the screen. Value will also be valid during BallonDisplaying event. You can use this property to further customize Balloon control before it is displayed to the user. You can also set it to your own instance of the Balloon control (or the control that is inheriting it) for ultimate customization options. Note that new instance of Balloon control is created each time Balloon needs to be displayed. Once Balloon is closed control is disposed.

member.summary: Specifies balloon style.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether balloon will close automatically when user click the close button.

member.summary: Saves current visual layout of navigation bar control to XML based file.
member.param: File name to save layout to.

member.summary: Saves current visual layout of navigation bar control to XmlElement.
member.param: XmlElement object that will act as a parent for the layout definition. Exact same element should be passed into the LoadLayout method to load the layout.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.PopupSelectedPane
member.summary: Popup selected pane when control is collapsed. When control is collapsed (Expanded=false) currently selected pane is not visible calling this method will popup selected pane and allow user access to it. Use PopupPaneVisible property to check whether currently selected pane is displayed as popup.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.HideSelectedPopupPane
member.summary: Hides popup selected pane when control is collapsed and selected pane is displayed as popup. When control is collapsed (Expanded=false) currently selected pane can be displayed as popup. Calling this method will hide the popup pane. Use PopupPaneVisible property to check whether currently selected pane is displayed as popup.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.LoadLayout(System.String)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.LoadLayout(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.
member.param: Parent XML element that is used to load layout from. Note that this must be the same element that was passed into the SaveLayout method.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.NavigationBarHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the navigation bar part of the navigation pane control. Navigation Bar height is automatically calculated based on the content. Setting this property suggests desired height of the navigation bar but the actual height will be calculated to ensure that complete buttons are visible so suggested and actual height might differ.

member.summary: Gets or sets the navigation bar definition string.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.AntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anti-alias smoothing is used while painting. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.AnimationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets animation time in milliseconds when control is expanded or collapsed. Default value is 100 miliseconds. You can set this to 0 (zero) to disable animation.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.CanCollapse
member.summary: Gets or sets whether navigation pane can be collapsed. Default value is false. When set to true expand/collapse button will be displayed in title so control can be reduced in size.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.TitleButtonAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets alignment of the expand button inside of title bar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets whether navigation pane is expanded. Default value is true. When control is collapsed it is reduced in size so it consumes less space.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationPane.PopupSelectedPaneVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether selected pane is displayed as popup when control is collapsed (Expanded=false). Using navigation pane button that is displayed when control is collapsed user can popup or close currently selected pane without expanding the control. You can use this property to do same from code as well as check whether selected pane is displayed as popup. Note that control must be collapsed (Expanded=false) in order for this property to have any effect.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BubbleBar.ImageSizeLarge
member.summary: Gets or sets size of the images when button is enlarged, default value is 48 by 48 pixels. Note that you should provide the images in the same size for the buttons through the image properties on the buttons or through ImagesLarge property. If the large images are not provided the regular button image will be automatically enlarged.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BubbleBar.ImageSizeNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets the normal image size for the buttons, default value is 24 by 24 pixels. This should be set to the default image size that you will use on the buttons. If the images specified for the buttons are not of the same size as the size specified here then they will be automatically resized. Normal size must always be smaller than the size specified by ImageSizeLarge property.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Close button that closes the active tab is visible.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button is visible on each tab instead of in system box.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabStrip.CloseButtonOnTabsAlwaysDisplayed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button on tabs when visible is displayed for every tab state. Default value is true. When set to false the close button will be displayed only for selected and tab that mouse is currently over.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabStrip.CloseButtonPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the close button displayed on each tab. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabStrip.TabCloseButtonNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button that allows user to close the tab. Use TabCloseButtonHot property to specify image that is used when mouse is over the close button. Note that image size must be same for both images. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabStrip.TabCloseButtonHot
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button whem mouse is over the close button. To use this property you must set TabCloseButtonNormal as well. Note that image size for both images must be same. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the group this tab belongs to. Groups are optional classification that is used to visually group tabs that belong to same functions. These tabs should be positioned next to each other.

member.summary: Gets or sets the panel assigned to this ribbon tab item.

member.summary: Returns the collection of sub items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonTabItem.AutoCollapseOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-collapse (fold) when clicked. When item is on popup menu and this property is set to false, menu will not close when item is clicked.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonTabItem.AutoExpandOnClick
member.summary: Indicates whether the item will auto-expand when clicked. When item is on top level bar and not on menu and contains sub-items, sub-items will be shown only if user click the expand part of the button. Setting this propert to true will expand the button and show sub-items when user clicks anywhere inside of the button. Default value is false which indicates that button is expanded only if its expand part is clicked.

member.summary: Represents Outlook 2003 like Navigation Bar.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.SetDesignTimeDefaults
member.summary: Applies design-time defaults to control.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.ShowMoreButtons
member.summary: Increases the size of the navigation bar if possible by showing more buttons on the top.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.ShowFewerButtons
member.summary: Reduces the size of the navigation bar if possible by showing fewer buttons on the top.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.SaveLayout(System.String)
member.summary: Saves current visual layout of navigation bar control to XML based file.
member.param: File name to save layout to.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.SaveLayout(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Saves current visual layout of navigation bar control to XmlElement.
member.param: XmlElement object that will act as a parent for the layout definition. Exact same element should be passed into the LoadLayout method to load the layout.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.LoadLayout(System.String)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.LoadLayout(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Loads navigation bar layout that was saved using SaveLayout method. Note that this method must be called after all items are created and added to the control.
member.param: Parent XML element that is used to load layout from. Note that this must be the same element that was passed into the SaveLayout method.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether Navigation Pane Options menu item is visible on Configure buttons menu.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether summary line is visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.ItemPaddingTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding in pixels at the top portion of the item. Height of each item will be increased by padding amount.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.NavigationBar.ItemPaddingBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding in pixels for bottom portion of the item. Height of each item will be increased by padding amount.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ColorExMapper.ColorSchemePart
member.summary: Specifies that color derived from system colors which is part of DotNetBar Color Scheme object is used. Colors derived from system colors are automatically refreshed when system colors are changed.
member.remarks: We recommend using this property to specify color rather than setting color directly. Using colors that are derived from system colors improves uniform look of your application and visual integration into user environment.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether expandable control ExpandableControl assigned to this splitter is expaned or not. Default value is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether Click event is triggering expand/collapse of the splitter. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.ExpandActionDoubleClick
member.summary: Gets or sets whether DoubleClick event is triggering expand/collapse of the splitter. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.Expandable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether splitter will act as expandable splitter. Default value is true. When set to true ExpandableControl property should be set to the control that should be expanded/collapsed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.ExpandableControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the control that will be expanded/collapsed by the splitter. Default value is null. Expandable property should be also set to true (default) to enable expand/collapse functionality.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets visual style of the control. Default value is eSplitterStyle.Office2003.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.AnimationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets animation time in milliseconds. Default value is 100 miliseconds. You can set this to 0 (zero) to disable animation.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.Shortcut
member.summary: Gets or sets the shortcut key to expand/collapse splitter.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for UI element. If used in combination with BackgroundColor2 is specifies starting gradient color.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor2
member.summary: Gets or sets the target gradient background color for UI element.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor2SchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as target gradient background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor2 property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor2 property.
