member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container. GalleryContainer automatically manages the layout orientation and this property should not be changed from its default value.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.HorizontalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item alignment when container is in horizontal layout. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.VerticalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item vertical alignment. Default value is Top.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.MultiLine
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items in horizontal layout are wrapped into the new line when they cannot fit allotted container size. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupUsesStandardScrollbars
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Gallery when on popup is using standard scrollbars to scroll the content. Standard scrollbars are displayed on right hand side of the Gallery. Default value for this property is true. When set to false the scroll buttons are displayed only when needed and two buttons on top and bottom of the Gallery are used to indicate the scrolling possiblity and enable scrolling. Buttons are only visible when needed. This scrolling button style can be used for example on Application Menu to enable scrolling of list of most recently used files.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.IncrementalSizing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gallery is using incremental sizing when stretched. Default value is true. Incremental sizing will resize the width of the gallery so it fits completely the items it can contain in available space. That means that gallery will occupy enough space to display the whole items within available space. When set to false, it indicates that gallery will resize to fill all available space.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.StretchGallery
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Gallery width is determined based on the RibbonBar width. This property is in effect when Gallery is hosted directly the RibbonBar control. Default value is false. When set to true the Gallery size is changed as the RibbonBar control is resized. The initial size of the Gallery is determined by DefaultSize property. The MinimumSize property specifies the minimum size of the Gallery. Note that only single Gallery can be stretched per RibbonBar control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupGalleryItems
member.summary: Gets the collection of the items that are added to the popup gallery. The items displayed on the gallery are combined with the items from this collection and they are displayed on the gallery popup. This collection can for example have items that are customizing the choices of the commands in gallery etc.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.DefaultSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the gallery. The gallery height will be always enforced so all scroll buttons can be displayed. Gallery width should allow display of both scroll buttons and the gallery content.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.PopupGallerySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the gallery when gallery is displayed on the popup menu.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.EnableGalleryPopup
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gallery can be displayed on the popup. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is expanded or not. For Popup items this would indicate whether the item is popped up or not.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.ScrollAnimation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether scroll animation is enabled. Default value is true. Scroll animation will be disabled if gallery is running under Remote Windows Terminal session or fade animation effect is disabled on the container control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.GalleryContainer.GalleryGroups
member.summary: Gets the collection of GalleryGroup objects associated with this gallery. Groups are assigned optionally to one or more items that are part of the GalleryContainer. Groups are used to visually group the items when gallery is displayed on the popup.

member.summary: Gets the collection of all tabs.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether tabs are visible. Default value is true.

member.summary: Returns reference to interal tab strip control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Use TabControlPanel.Style property to set the background image for each tab panel.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.Animate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tab scrolling is animanted.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.AutoHideSystemBox
member.summary: Gets or sets whether system box that enables scrolling and closing of the tabs is automatically hidden when tab items size does not exceed the size of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.CanReorderTabs
member.summary: Specifes whether end-user can reorder the tabs.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.AutoCloseTabs
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tab is automatically closed when close button is clicked. Closing the tab will remove tab being closed from Tabs collection and it will remove the panel as well. Default value is false which means that tab will not be closed and you should handle TabClose event to perform desired action as result of user closing the tab.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Close button that closes the active tab is visible on system box.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonOnTabsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button is visible on each tab instead of in system box.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonOnTabsAlwaysDisplayed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether close button on tabs when visible is displayed for every tab state. Default value is true. When set to false the close button will be displayed only for selected and tab that mouse is currently over.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.CloseButtonPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the close button displayed on each tab. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabCloseButtonNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button that allows user to close the tab. Use TabCloseButtonHot property to specify image that is used when mouse is over the close button. Note that image size must be same for both images. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabCloseButtonHot
member.summary: Gets or sets custom image that is used on tabs as Close button whem mouse is over the close button. To use this property you must set TabCloseButtonNormal as well. Note that image size for both images must be same. Default value is null which means that internal representation of close button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.DisplaySelectedTextOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether only selected tab is displaying it's text.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.ImageList
member.summary: Gets or sets the image list used by tab items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.ScrollOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets scrolling offset of the first tab. You can use this property to programmatically scroll the tab strip.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets Tab Control style. Theme style is supported only on themed OS and only for bottom or top aligned tabs.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.ThemeAware
member.summary: Specifies whether tab is drawn using Themes when running on OS that supports themes like Windows XP.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabScrollAutoRepeat
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tabs are scrolled continuously while mouse is pressed over the scroll tab button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.TabControl.TabScrollRepeatInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the auto-repeat interval for the tab scrolling while mouse button is kept pressed over the scroll tab button.

member.summary: Gets or sets Tab Color Scheme.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tab alignment within the Tab-Strip control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the selected tab.

member.summary: Gets or sets the selected tab Font

member.summary: Occurs before an item in option group is checked and provides opportunity to cancel that.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SideBar.ToolTipShowing
member.summary: Occurs before tooltip for an item is shown. Sender could be the BaseItem or derived class for which tooltip is being displayed or it could be a ToolTip object itself it tooltip is not displayed for any item in particular.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SideBar.SerializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data with the item and load it back up in DeserializeItem event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SideBar.DeserializeItem
member.summary: Occurs after an item has been de-serialized (load) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeItem event.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.SideBar.UsingSystemColors
member.summary: Gets or sets whether flat side bar is using system colors.
member.remarks: This property is used internally by side bar to determine whether to reset color scheme based on system colors. If you want side bar to use system colors you need to set PredefinedColorScheme property.

member.summary: Processes OnMouseMove events from DockSite. This routine assumes that mouse messages are received only when mouse is actualy over the dock site and not containing bars. This is significant becouse it will receive messages only if mouse is over the splitter space between bars.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DocumentDockUIManager.SetBarWidth(DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the width of the bar that is managed by this document layout. Width can be set only if parent container has Horizontal orientation. Note that bar minimum size is respected by this method and it will be enforced. If width is less than minimum width bar's width will be set to minimum width.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DocumentDockUIManager.SetBarHeight(DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the height of the bar that is managed by this document layout. Height can be set only if parent container has vertical orientation. Note that bar minimum size is respected by this method and it will be enforced. If height is less than minimum height bar's height will be set to minimum height.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherAccessibleName
member.summary: Gets or sets the Accessible name for the Dialog Launcher button

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.BackgroundMouseOverStyle
member.summary: Specifies the background style of the control when mouse is over the control. Style specified here will be applied to the BackgroundStyle.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherButton
member.summary: Gets or sets image that is used as dialog luncher button in ribbon title bar. Default value is null which indicates that default appearance for the button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherMouseOverButton
member.summary: Gets or sets image that is used as dialog luncher button when mouse is over the button. Note that if this property is set you also must set the DialogLauncherButton property. Images set to both properties must have same size. Default value is null which indicates that default appearance for the button is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.MaximumOverflowTextLength
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum text length for automatic overflow button text. When overflow button is created due to the reduced size of the control text for the button can be specifed using OverflowButtonText property. If text is not specified RibbonBar.Text property is used as overflow button text. In that case this property specifies maximum length of the text to display on the button. Default value is 25. You can set this property to 0 to use complete text regardless of length.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResizeOrderIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets resize order index of the control. When control is parented to RibbonPanel control (which is the case when control is used as part of RibbonControl) index specified here indicates the order in which controls that are part of the same panel are resized. Lower index value indicates that control should be resized later when size needs to be reduced or earlier when size needs to be increased. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.AutoOverflowEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether automatic overflow handling is enabled. When overflow is enabled if control is resized below the size that is needed to display its complete content overflow button is created and all content is moved to the overflow button popup. Control will only display overflow button when in this state and user can click overflow button to display the actual content of the control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.OverflowButtonText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text for overflow button that is created when ribbon bar size is reduced so it cannot display all its content. When control is resized so it cannot display its content overflow button is created which is displayed on face of the control. Complete content of the control is then displayed on popup toolbar when user clicks overflow button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.OverflowButtonImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the Image for overflow button that is created when ribbon bar size is reduced so it cannot display all its content. When control is resized so it cannot display its content overflow button is created which is displayed on face of the control. Complete content of the control is then displayed on popup toolbar when user clicks overflow button. This Image is also used when RibbonBar is added to the Quick Access Toolbar to identify the RibbonBar button.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.DialogLauncherVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether dialog launcher button is visible in title of the ribbon. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets default layout orientation inside the control. You can have multiple layouts inside of the control by adding one or more instances of the ItemContainer object and chaning it's LayoutOrientation property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ItemSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets spacing in pixels between items. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.ResizeItemsToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether items contained by container are resized to fit the container bounds. When container is in horizontal layout mode then all items will have the same height. When container is in vertical layout mode then all items will have the same width. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.HorizontalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item alignment when container is in horizontal layout. Default value is Left.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.RibbonBar.VerticalItemAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the item vertical alignment. Default value is Top.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether ribbon bar can be customized by end user i.e. added to Quick Access Toolbar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.MinimumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the item. When used please note that layout logic for dockable windows expects that all DockContainerItems that are in particular docking side have exact same minimum size. When setting this property it is best to set the same value for all DockContainerItem instances you create.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.DefaultFloatingSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default floating size of the Bar that is containing this item.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.MinFormClientSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the form client area that is tried to maintain when dockable window is resized.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the item expands automatically to fill out the remaining space inside the container. Applies to Items on stretchable, no-wrap Bars only.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.CanCustomize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item can be customized by end user.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.DesignMode
member.summary: Returns whether item is in design mode or not.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DockContainerItem.GlobalItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether item is global or not. This flag is used to propagate property changes to all items with the same name. Setting for example Visible property on the item that has GlobalItem set to true will set visible property to the same value on all items with the same name.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.ButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eButtonColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements. Name specified there can be used in ButtonItem.CustomColorName property to specify custom color table for an ButtonItem.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style when button is on RibbonBar control. When collection is empty the values from the ButtonItemColors collections are used instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.MenuButtonItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007ButtonItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a button with Office 2007 style when button is on menu bar. When collection is empty the values from the ButtonItemColors collections are used instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabItemColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007RibbonTabItemColorTable objects the describe colors used by a ribbon tab with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eRibbonTabColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements. Name specified there can be used in RibbonTabItem.CustomColorName property to specify custom color table for an ButtonItem.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Rendering.Office2007ColorTable.RibbonTabGroupColors
member.summary: Gets the reference to collection of Office2007RibbonTabGroupColorTableCollection objects the describe colors used by a ribbon tab groups with Office 2007 style. The collection by default has elements that are created to represents the members of eRibbonTabGroupColor enumeration. The name of each color table object is the same as the string enum representation. You can add custom members to this collection or modify the existing ones. Note that you must specify the unique name for the new color table elements.
